fork_status_and_schedule.highlight: BPO2 and Holesky Fusaka activation completed successfully; BP01 expected live later this week

critical_infrastructure.highlight: Prysm rejecting attestations from nodes where target.epoch minus source.epoch exceeds 2, causing peer disconnections
Incorrect KZG proofs discovered in network, primarily from Lodestar, affecting blob sidecars across testnets

client_updates.highlight: Prysm and Lodestar working on fixes for attestation and zero proof bugs respectively, requiring soaking time
Nethermind facing sync regression; Erigon released 3.2.2 with Fusaka and 60M gas limit

testing_progress.highlight: BAL test v1.3.0 results: 98% overall - Besu 100%, Reth 100%, Geth 99%, Nethermind 91%
ePBS consensus specs v1.6.0 and v1.6.0-beta.2 released

organizational.highlight: Testing Complexity Assessment Checklist introduced for Amsterdam EIPs with focus on repricing
Client teams need to assign primary and backup coordinators for mainnet incident response

action_items.action: Fix and release Prysm attestation bug and Lodestar KZG proof bug
Release mainnet clients with Fusaka support and 60M gas limit by November 5th
Signal readiness and launch Glamsterdam devnet-0 with updated test suite
Prioritize repricing EIPs for testing complexity assessment
Assign coordinators and submit PRs to incident response plan

decisions.decision: Maintain December 3rd mainnet fork date; re-evaluate Thursday if releases not ready by November 5th
Prioritize repricing EIPs for testing assessment before other Amsterdam proposals

targets.target: November 5th - Final deadline for mainnet client releases
December 3rd - Fusaka mainnet fork (pending release checkpoint)
